main.name: Carlos Lopez
main.description: I design and program websites and web applications of all types. I also hope to share my web dev experiences while helping others on their coding journey
main.bio: I am a bad hombre! Hire me. I will do great things.  Yuge!!  Ask anyone.  Ask my mom.

education.school: The UT Coding Bootcamp at UT Austin
education.description: In this program I recieved a variety of full-stack developer experience that allowed me to build on the skills that make proficient in frontend and backend technologies. I learned HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery and Node.js, as well as PHP frameworks like Laravel, and database systems such as MySQL and MongoDB.

education.degree: Master of Education: Curriculum & Instruction with an E-Learning/ Tech Education Specialization.
education.description: summarize distance/blended instruction and dev opportunities.

education.degree: Bachelor of Business Administration: Information Systems Specialization. Spanish Double Major
education.description: highlights:Represented Wayland Baptist University to lobby for Texas Equalization Grant at the Capitol in Austin, Texas. Student Government: Senior Senator.Freshman orientation team leader. Volunteer big brother for underprivileged students in Plainview community schools. Member of “Team Wayland” community service activity group. 2-year NAIA varsity athlete for WBU Pioneers – Pitcher.

work.company: LBJ Early College High School- Austin Independent School District
work.title: Spanish Teacher
work.description: LBJ HIGH Lights: P-tech, Twilight, etc..

projects.title: Cheevr
projects.description: An application created in a team of three developers that utilizes Amazon Alexa’s voice recognition and AWS to allow users to create oral review flashcards and quizzes utilizing HTML 5, CSS3, and Google Material design to style the front end and Implemented combinations of Javascript and JQuery, Node, MySQL , AWS Oauth, and Amazon Alexa API to put together backend.

projects.title: French.Press.Play
projects.description: Group Project with 3 other developers: A dynamic web page that was created in a team of three developers to help walk the user through the process of making coffee in a French Press and help them stay focused while providing activities. Built using HTML5, CSS3, and Bootsrap to style and Javascript for logic along with Giphy, YouTube, and Google Maps API.

projects.title: GiphyLube
projects.description: Using GIPHY API to make a dynamic web page that populates with gifs. To finish this task. GIPHY API calls and HTML made with JavaScript and jQuery

projects.title: Friend Finder
projects.description: A full-stack, Compatibility-based "FriendFinder" site that will take in users' results from surveys and compare their answers with those from other users. The app will then display the name and picture of the user with the best overall match. This javascript app runs on Express to handle routing.

projects.title: Eat Da Burger
projects.description: A burger logger with MySQL, Node, Express, Handlebars, and ORM following model-view-controller (MVC) design pattern. Uses Node and MySQL to query and route data while Handlebars generates HTML.

projects.title: Psychic Game
projects.description: Psychic html game using javscript and Google's Material Design

projects.title: Pepe Redux: The Frog that once was.
projects.description: Pepe was once an innocent cartoon character. This quiz revisits his origins Trivia game built with JavaScript for the logic and jQuery to manipulate HTML.

projects.title: Train Station
projects.description: A train schedule app that incorporates Firebase to host arrival and departure data. Moment.js retrieves and manipulates time to provide up-to-date information about arrival times and how many minutes remain until various trains arrive at their station

testimonials.text: This guy puts the third plus in C+++
This guy codes like a reverse mullet.  Party up front and all business in the back! Heyo!
